Mitic Wars – Jediel is a small game focused in one character story, aiming to present a background from a bigger plot.

The World

The adventure takes part on Jiordan, a village in the central region of the kingdom of Oliaf, its entire population is poor, except for the Veighan, a family who retains domain over a good portion of the lands of the area. Its proximity to the Anglo-South Road, one of the main routes of continental commerce, has improved its economy, as usually merchants and travelers stop by there, bringing with them exotic items from all around the world. The villa also stablishes trade arrangements with the villages of Arpur on the north and Acclamassia on the South, however the merchants avoid crossing the forest on the south of the village, which they believe to be cursed by a witch.

Characters Jediel
A young orphan who was adopted by old Gerusa when he was like eight years old, he doesn’t remember much of his infancy and the time before he arrived at the village. He’s tormented by nightmares and have psionic powers which he doesn’t control that well.
Rallie
A girl who used to live travelling with her father, a traveling salesman, becoming an orphan when a group of bandits killed her father on the Anglo-South Road while she was still a child, soon after she was adopted by old Gerusa. She considers herself to be a psychic and works as a gypsy, practicing divination for the people of Jiordan.
Dellion
Abandoned still a newborn in old Gerusa’s house, being the first child adopted by her, he is very attached to his mother and can lose his mind sometimes, however he’s usually a funny person who loves his family.
Gerusa
A woman who has lost a child and, after receiving a newborn in her door, she decided to dedicate her life to save abandoned children. Her life became harder after her husband’s death, but it all begins to get better again after some of the children grew up and started to aid her in the maintaining of the house, who still to this day receive children in need.
Lord Veighan
The wealthiest man of Jiordan, even though his family isn’t officially in control of the village, the Veighan have a lot of influence on its rule, funding half of the village’s guard. Lately his interest in negotiating with foreigners of the Free Lands, the continent beyond the ocean, has raised.
Mr. Owl
A mysterious man with unknown origins and alignments, he dresses flamboyant and has accent and skin tone from the Free Lands.
